data.title: Gazette Classifieds: Obituaries
data.text:
THROPP MARY LOUISE (PARKER) OF...

THROPP MARY LOUISE (PARKER) Of Elliott, age 93, on Sunday, September 22, 2013. Wife of the late Maurice F. Thropp, Sr.; loving mother of Maurice "Buzz" (Pat) Thropp, Jr. and the late Rita (Chuck) Martinez; cherished grandmother of Pauline Ruefle, Anthony Martinez, David Martinez, Thomas Martinez, Shelly Thropp-Bird and Carey Mihal; also survived by eight great-grandchildren. Mary Louise was a longtime resident of Arrowood, West Mifflin. Friends received Tuesday 6-8 p.m. at PAUL L. HENNEY MEMORIAL CHAPEL, 5570 Library Rd., Bethel Park. Mass of Christian Burial will be offered Wednesday, 12 p.m. at St. Joan of Arc Church. In lieu of flowers, family suggests donations in her memory to Cure Alzheimer's Fund, 34 Washington, Suite 200, Wellesley Hills, MA 02481. www.henneyfuneralhome.com Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

↧

LALAMA BERTHA BETTY M. (REVE...

LALAMA BERTHA BETTY M. (REVELL) Age 81, of Findlay Township, formerly of Sewickley, passed away unexpectedly on Sunday, September 22, 2013, at UPMC Mercy. Betty was born in Newhall, WV on July 8, 1932 to the late Frank and Louise (Walker) Revell. On July 15, 2013, she was preceded in death by her beloved husband of 58 years, Anthony J. Lalama; loving mother of Lisa A. Lalama (Daniel DePietropaolo, M.D.) of Wilmington, DE, Jeffrey R. Lalama (Alexandra) of Bethel Park and Craig R. Lalama (Laurie) of Findlay Township; cherished grandmother of Megan, Andrew, Candice, Chelsy, Samantha, Brandon and Natalie; sister of Lois Scuilli (the late Paul) of Edgeworth and Judith Messinger (David) of Boston; niece of Frances Mullins; also loving nieces, nephews and cousins. Her greatest joy came from the time spent with her grandchildren. Betty was a member of the Beaver Valley Herb Society and the Western PA Unit of the Herb Society of America. Visitation Wednesday 2-4, 7-9 at COPELAND'S SEWICKLEY, 702 Beaver St., where service will be held on Thursday at 11 a.m. Rev. William Johnson will officiate. Burial will follow in the National Cemetery of the Alleghenies. In lieu of flowers, family suggests donations to the Alzheimer's Association, Greater PA Chapter, 1100 Liberty Ave., Suite E-201, Pittsburgh, PA 15222. The family wants to thank the staff of Life Pittsburgh, especially Starr, Karen, and Tony as well as Juanita DiNunno, who spent years caring for Betty and her husband. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

MONTECALVO CHRISTINE CHRIS C...

MONTECALVO CHRISTINE CHRIS C. 85, of Cranston Rhode Island, died Saturday, September 21, 2013, at Forbes Hospice in Pittsburgh, PA. She is survived by her beloved husband of 65 years, Joseph; and her five children, Dr. Joseph Montecalvo, Jr., Deborah Couture, Joan Migliori, Mary Ellen Ferri, and David Montecalvo. She is also survived by daughters -in-law, Laura (Joseph), Nicole (David); and son-in-law Richard (Joan). She was the proud grandmother of ten, Joseph III, Jennifer, John, Christopher, Kristen, Lauren, Brian, Justin, Kali, David, Jr.; and also the great-grandmother of four. Christine was born in Providence, Rhode Island. She was the mother of the late Patrick and Mary DeSimone; and sister of the late Patrick DeSimone, Joseph DeSimone, Ann Grande, Ella Brown and Mary D'Ambrosio. Christine graduated with honors from Mount Pleasant High School in 1946. She was a devoted parishioner of Immaculate Conception Church, Cranston. Relatives and friends will be received on Thursday from 1-4 p.m. at the WARCHOL FUNERAL HOME INC., 3060 Washington Pike, Bridgeville (412-221-3333). A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated on Friday at 10 a.m. at Holy Child Parish, 212 Station Street, Bridgeville, PA. Interment to follow in Melrose Cemetery, 3060 Washington Pike, Bridgeville, PA. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in her memory to Forbes Hospice, West Penn Allegheny Hospital, Pittsburgh, PA. View and send condolences at: www.warcholfuneralhome.com Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

SBRACCIA KEITH D. SUDDENLY, IN...

SBRACCIA KEITH D. Suddenly, in his Kennedy Twp. home, on Sunday, September 22, 2013, Keith D., age 58. Beloved husband for 36 years of Janet (Whitaker) Sbraccia; dear father of Gary P. Sbraccia; loving "Poppy" to Angalique, Devin and Gabriella; son of the late Carl, Sr. and Eleanor Sbraccia; brother of Carl, Jr., Richard and the late Evelyn and Diane. There will be no public visitation. Friends and family are invited to a memorial service in the First United Presbyterian Church of Crafton Heights, 50 Stratmore Ave., Pgh., PA 15205 on Saturday, October 5, 2013 at 10 a.m. Arrangements entrusted to HERSHBERGER - STOVER, INC. FUNERAL HOME, Crafton. Keith was a former co-owner of Sheraden Auto in Elliott. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

Preceded in death by his two brothers, Russell and Daniel Blystone; husband of Sarah Lyons Blystone; and two sisters-in-law, Shirley Hopkins and Myra Weschitz; nieces and nephews. Friends received 2-4, 6-8 p.m. Thursday at the JAMES W. SHIRLEY FUNERAL HOME, INC., 176 Clay Pike, North Huntingdon, PA. Funeral Service at 10 a.m. on Friday in the funeral home chapel. RICHARDS-SZAFRANSKI JULIE A. A...

RICHARDS-SZAFRANSKI JULIE A. Age 38, unexpectedly on Saturday, September 21, 2013. Wife of Willie Szafranski; beloved mother of Julyan Carrington, Khaiya and Erykah Richards; daughter of the late William Richards. Survived by her mother, Patricia Richards Reese; and stepfather, Ronald Reese; sister of John (Hanah), William (Cara) and Trish (Dennis) Richards; also survived by aunts, uncle, nieces, nephews and cousins. Friends received Tuesday 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. and Wednesday 2-4 and 6 until time of prayer service at 8 p.m. at the READSHAW FUNERAL HOME, INC., 1503 Brownsville Road, Carrick. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the family. Send condolences to: www.readshawfuneralhome.com Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

SAUER REV. DR. ROBERT C. BELOV...

SAUER REV. DR. ROBERT C. Beloved husband of Joyce (Johnson); loving father of Sharman (Donald) Klinefelter and Sheryl Sauer. Born in Elgin, Illinois on November 18, 1921, formerly of Mt. Lebanon, PA. Son of the late Oscar and Eleanor Sauer; brother, Delmont Sauer; sisters, Althea Markworth and Ruth Schulth, preceded him in death. He was an Eagle Scout, a graduate of Elgin High School, Concordia College, River Forest, IL, and Concordia Theological Seminary, Springfield, IL. He served 25 years as a parish pastor and a U.S. Air Force Chaplain during the Korean War. He also served in the U.S. Air Force Reserve. In 1974 he became assistant to the synodical president of the Lutheran Church Missouri Synod, a post he held until his election as a first vice-president. Concordia Seminary, St. Louis awarded him an Honorary Doctor of Divinity degree in 1976. Rev. Robert Sauer was a former pastor of Our Savior Lutheran Church, Mt. Lebanon, PA. He was a member of Chapel of the Cross Lutheran Church, St. Peters, MO and a resident of St. Charles, MO. Visitation and Services will be held Tuesday, September 24, 2013 at Chapel of the Cross Lutheran Church, 907 Jungermann Road, St. Peters, Missouri. Visitation will be from 10:00-11:00 a.m. and a Funeral Service at 11:00 a.m. Memorials may be sent to Concordia Seminary, Fort Wayne, IN, Concordia Seminary, St. Louis, MO, Radio Station KFUO. Burial will be in Oak Hill Cemetery, Neenah, Wisconsin, with military color guard. The family is being served by THE BAUE FUNERAL HOME, 620 Jefferson Street, St. Charles, MO. Visit www.Baue.com. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

GEORGE PEARL OF HOUSTON, TX, F...

GEORGE PEARL Of Houston, TX, formerly of Pittock, PA, passed away peacefully on September 15, 2013, at the age of 96. She was the wife of the late Getty George; and beloved mother of Getty (Lori Lee) George, the late Raymond (Linda) George, and Ronald (Barbara) George; grandmother to Beth, Joani, Chip, Ron Jr., Raymond, Sharon, Kevin, and the late Matthew; great-grandmother to Brittany, Robbie, Lauren, Andrew, Bradley, Natalie, Katie, Hannah, Dylan, Getty V., CJ, Lilly, and Robert. Private service will be held at FOREST PARK WESTHEIMER FUNERAL HOME in Houston, Texas. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

↧

GRUPP ANITA AGE 86, BELOVED WI...

GRUPP ANITA Age 86, beloved wife of Edward A. Grupp for 63 years, passed away on September 22, 2013, at Allegheny General Hospital. She was the daughter of the late Elizabeth and Morris Perlmutter; and sister of the late Joan Adell. She leaves her daughters, Marcy (of Pittsburgh), Lori (of Wilmette, IL); and her son, Jerold (Francine) (of Holland, PA) to mourn her. She also leaves two grandsons, Nathaniel and Jacob Grupp; and her nephew, Steven Adell. Anita was born a Valentine's Day baby in 1927, a date celebrated by Ed through a gold heart charm engraved with the notes to "My Funny Valentine." Born in Philadelphia, she moved to Cleveland as a young child. There, she graduated from Glenville High School and worked for the Securities and Exchange Commission and also for Social Security, while attending night classes at Cleveland College. After her marriage to Ed, and the birth of three children, the young family moved to Mt. Lebanon in 1958, where they resided. In Mt. Lebanon, Anita was the owner of Anita Grupp Field Research Service and gave many homemakers an opportunity to work. Most of all, Anita was a passionate traveler, and with Ed, saw the cities of the world from Athens to Zurich and many points in between. She visited every continent (but Antarctica). Services will be held at Temple Emanuel, Bower Hill Road, on Wednesday at 10:30 a.m. Visitation with the family will be held one hour before the services. Burial will be at Mt. Lebanon Cemetery, Temple Emanuel section immediately following the service. Arrangements entrusted to WILLIAM SLATER II FUNERAL SERVICE, 412-563-2800. Donations may be made in Anita's memory to Doctors Without Borders at Doctorswithoutborders.org or to the charity of the donor's choice. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

GALLAGHER LOUISE A. AGE 88, OF...

GALLAGHER LOUISE A. Age 88, of Butler, formerly of Pittsburgh, on Sunday, September 22, 2013. Wife of the late William A. Wright. Friends will be received Wednesday 6-9 p.m. at the BOCK FUNERAL HOME, LTD., 1500 Mt. Royal Blvd., Glenshaw, where a funeral service will be held on Thursday at 11 a.m. Donations may be sent to Lighthouse Ministries, Butler, PA. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

WENSEL GEORGE L., JR. 62, of West Homestead, on Sept. 20, 2013. MONTECALVO CHRISTINE C. CHRIS...

MONTECALVO CHRISTINE C. CHRIS 85, of Cranston, Rhode Island, died Saturday, September 21, 2013, at Forbes Hospice in Pittsburgh, PA. She is survived by her beloved husband of 65 years, Joseph; and her five children, Dr. Joseph Montecalvo Jr., Deborah Couture, Joan Migliori, Mary Ellen Ferri, and David Montecalvo. She is also survived by daughters-in-law, Laura (Joseph), Nicole (David; and son-in-law, Richard (Joan). She was the proud grandmother of ten, Joseph III, Jennifer, John, Christopher, Kristen, Lauren, Brian, Justin, Kali, David Jr.; and also the great-grandmother of four. Christine was born in Providence, Rhode Island. She was the daughter of the late Patrick and Mary DeSimone; and sister of the late, Patrick DeSimone, Joseph DeSimone, Ann Grande, Ella Brown, and Mary D'Ambrosio. Christine graduated with honors from Mount Pleasant High School in 1946. She was a devoted parishioner of Immaculate Conception Church, Cranston. Relatives and friends will be received on Thursday from 1-4 p.m. at the WARCHOL FUNERAL HOME INC., 3060 Washington Pike, Bridgeville (412-221-3333). A Mass of Christian Burial will be celebrated on Friday at 10 a.m. at Holy Child Parish, 212 Station Street, Bridgeville, PA. Interment to follow at Melrose Cemetery, 3060 Washington Pike, Bridgeville, PA . In lieu of flowers, donations may be made in her memory to Forbes Hospice, West Penn Allegheny Hospital, Pittsburgh, PA. View and send condolences at: www.warcholfuneralhome.com Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

CHISMAR PATRICIA PAT UNEXPEC...

CHISMAR PATRICIA PAT Unexpectedly, on Saturday, September 21, 2013. Daughter of the late Fran and Betty Downing; beloved wife of George; loving mother of Douglas (Julie) Chismar, Pamela (Bill) Bergamasco, Brenda (Ray) LaBertew; grandmother of Jennifer (Don) Smith, Jodi (Dwayne) Wilson, Hannah Chismar, James Bergamasco, William (Lisa) Bergamasco, Bethany and Ryan LaBertew; great-grandmother of Kyzen, Mason and Jaxson Smith, Alexis, Sabrina, Ava and Dakota Wilson, Samantha, Dominic and Giavonna Bergamasco; loving friend to so many. SCHEURING IMELDA AGE 93, FORME...

SCHEURING IMELDA Age 93, formerly of Perrytown Place, Ross Twp., died on Saturday, September 21, 2013. Daughter of the late Lawrence and Hilda (Depp) Scheuring; sister of the late Elmer Scheuring and Vera Hilderhoff; aunt of Charlotte and William Hilderhoff, Terri and Kenneth Hilderhoff, Greg and Linda Scheuring, and Jeffrey and Marie Scheuring; also survived by great and great-great-nieces and nephews. DEEDLER JUNE M. (ADDISON) AGE ...

DEEDLER JUNE M. (ADDISON) Age 90, of Shaler Twp., formerly of Detroit, on Sunday, September 22, 2013. Wife of the late Clifford J. Deedler; mother of Earl W. (Patty) Deedler of Monroeville, PA; grandmother of Bridgette Gould and Tiffany Amato; great-grandmother of Greg Amato, Courtney Frye and Billy Gould; sister of Donna Hoss. No visitation. Services and interment will be private. Arrangements by BOCK FUNERAL HOME, LTD., Glenshaw, PA. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

SCIULLO JOSEPHINE M. (CALCAGNO...

SCIULLO JOSEPHINE M. (CALCAGNO) Age 90, of Dunedin, FL, formerly of Bloomfield, died peacefully at the Suncoast Hospice Care Center, Palm Harbor, FL, on Thursday, September 19, 2013. Josephine was a loving and devoted wife, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother and aunt. Her family drew from her sweet and kind-hearted nature, her compassion toward others and her devotion to those she loved. She was always called on to make her pizzelles and Italian wedding soup for the holidays and special occasions. Her three sons adored her. Josephine was predeceased by her beloved husband of 50 years, Ralph A. Sciullo; her parents, Anthony and Ann Calcagno; her siblings, Selma Pelusi, Madeline Klimovich, Paul Calcagno and Ann Graziano. She is survived by her sons, Frank A. Sciullo, Rafael J. Sciullo and Richard P. (Mary Anne) Sciullo; grandchildren, Bryan Sciullo, Kimberly (Patrick) Shepard, Sara and Erica Sciullo; great-grandchild, Larissa Shepard; caregiver, Georgeen McCreary; and many nieces and nephews. Friends received Wednesday 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. at WINTER FUNERAL HOME PC, 4730 Friendship Ave. Services will be held at 10 a.m. Thursday at the funeral home. Interment immediately following in Calvary Cemetery. The Sciullo family requests memorial contributions be made to Suncoast Hospice, 5771 Roosevelt Blvd., Clearwater, FL 33760. www.winterfuneralhomepc.com Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

↧

DENT RONALD K. SUDDENLY ON WED...

DENT RONALD K. Suddenly on Wednesday, September 18, 2013, Ronald K. Dent, of Sterling, VA, formerly of Pittsburgh, PA, departed this life. Son of the late Andrew L. and Laura F. Dent. He leaves to mourn, his daughters, Laura Nevels, Rhonda K. Jones (Bruce); adopted son, Jeff Thomas; brother, Andrew L. Dent, Jr. (Janice); sisters, Barbara Dent and Betty Chatman; and a host of family and friends. Services to be held at the RAPP FUNERAL HOME, 10940 Frankstown Road, Pittsburgh, PA 15235. Viewing, Wednesday, September 25, 2013 from 2-4 and 6-8 p.m. Funeral service, Thursday, September 26, 2013 at 11 a.m. Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧

MILITO ANTHONY 4-1-91 ~ LIFE ~...

MILITO ANTHONY 4-1-91 ~ LIFE ~ 9-24-12 I'll lend you for a little time a child of mine, he said. For you to love the while he lives and mourn for when he's dead. It may be six or seven years or twenty-one or three; But will you, 'til I call him back, take care of him for me? Now will you give him all your love nor think the labor vain, Nor hate Me when I come to call him back again. For all the joy Thy child shall bring, the risk of grief we'll run. But should the angels call for him much sooner than we've planned, We'll brave the bitter grief that comes and try to understand. Profoundly Missed and Deeply Loved,Your Family and Friends

↧

BOSETTI CHARLES ALBERT OF PITT...

BOSETTI CHARLES ALBERT Of Pittsburgh, on September 12, 2013, age 92. Beloved husband of the late Therese (Macaluso) Bosetti; father of Charles J. Bosetti, Michael Bosetti, Marina (Jim Crites) Bosetti, Matthew Bosetti, Terri (David) Hollowell and Anne Marie (Chris) Lagalante; grandfather of Stephanie Milich. Charles grew up during the Great Depression and enlisted with the Marines in 1942. He participated in the battles at Guam and Iwo Jima and was awarded a Purple Heart for wounds received at Guam. Charles was the founder of Malco Construction Company which he owned and operated for thirty five years. He built dozens of homes in the West Mifflin and Munhall areas. Strong willed to the very end, Charles maintained an active life until the many years caught up with him in 2007. Friends received SAVOLSKIS - WASIK - GLENN FUNERAL HOME, INC., 3501 Main Street, Munhall, Wednesday 6 to 8 p.m. Blessing Service Thursday 10 a.m. in the funeral home. Followed by private burial. www.swgfuneralhome.com Send condolences at post-gazette.com/gb

↧
